title: Need to login to my yahoo email each time I open firefox. (won't save login passwords)

title: Privacy and security part of account may have been hacked
content: I think the section Privacy and Security may have been hacked. First, the settings Ask to save logins and passwords for websites was turned off effectively turning off auto fill then Proxy was turned on. I didn't make either of those settings. Also, metro PCS website has been blocked. Error message says This problem can sometimes be caused by disabling or refusing to accept cookies. I did not make any changes to cause cookies to be refused or disabled and had been on that site a couple days prior. I'm thinking this has to be a hack because my Chewy account was hacked, ID changed, login pop up to sign in was changed and 2 orders were made. I reported it to PayPal and contacted Chewy and got the orders canceled and account closed only to get a notice the next day that the account was reopened. I almost had to have them list me as having to contact them by phone or chat to open an account in order to close all accounts and make sure no more accounts were opened in my name. I will be contact Metro PCS also because other numbers on my account have been hacked or have had problems. I'm trying to catch this thing on all sides. If possible, if there is a way to see if someone else accessed my account it would be appreciated. I connect to my account on laptop only at home 1 location and on my phone. I think the number is on file.

title: Whatsapp Web não carrega no Firefox
content:
Bom dia,

Faz algum tempo que estou com problema na utilização do Whatsapp web no Firefox.

Achei que fosse uma incompatibilidade de versão, que seria solucionado na seguinte, mas já vieram algumas atualizações e o problema continua.

Li a solução dada pelo Samuel Santos, de 2/24/21, que sugere a utilização pelo modo de segurança (modo solução de problemas, na versão atual) e o problema persiste.

Quando eu tento acessar o site do Whatsappweb, é como se a página estivesse sendo recarregada muitas vezes, o "X" do refresh de página fica piscando muito rapidamente, sem parar e nada acontece.

Gostaria de uma solução para voltar a usar o Firefox, que considero um browser mais leve e confiável que o Chrome, que estou sendo obrigado a usar nesse período de problemas.

title: Sync feature not working on new device
content:
Hey guys,

I transitioned over to a new Macbook. After installing Firefox I opted to log in to my "sync account" in order to retrieve all my bookmarks, add-ons, saved passwords etc. that I was using on my previous Macbook. On the old Mac, I synced the Firefox profile data one last time and formatted the device. Now when I log in with the account, no data gets synced. There definitely was an account as when I followed the sign-in process, it didn't ask me to create a new account. It simply asked for my email, followed by my password and the One-Time-Password that was sent to my email.

As a test, I signed out of this profile on the new Mac after not getting any results and tried to sign in with another Firefox profile. It immediately started retrieving that profile's data (I.e add-ons started getting installed). I cancelled that sync to not fill the browser with that data. But logging into the troublesome account again, still no data gets retrieved.

I really need to retrieve that profile with all my data. Any assistance would be much appreciated.
creator: ryan76

title: Printing with system dialog box
content:
I'm using Mac OS and the system dialog works better for me than the one provided by Firefox. And if a preview is necessary, it is possible to activate "Preview" from the system dialog box (Additionally offers the possibility of generating a pdf).

On this forum the subject is very present; there are a large number of "about:config" keys whose modification is supposed to provide a solution; it's a big mess. Some changes that worked with Firefox 101 no longer work after updating to Firefox 102. Eventually I found an answer here:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1363191

This question is important. Can you suggest a stable and accessible solution for future Firefox updates? An option in the "Preferences" menu?

title: OPEN URL IN MICROSOFT EDGE (CONTEXT MENU)
content:
I am attempting to build a script (extension) that will open any focused page in Firefox with Microsoft Edge from the context menu. The intention is to utilise the existing microsoft-edge URL Protocol in Windows instead of a native client.

The code below does in fact open Edge but only as a New Tab page and not the intended Firefox URL.

I seem to be missing something so any assistance would be appreciated.

function ff2edge(url) { 

   var link = url.replace(new RegExp("^.*//"),"microsoft-edge://")    browser.tabs.executeScript({        code: `window.location = "` + link + `";`    });

}

browser.contextMenus.create({ 

   id: "ff2edge",    title: "Open with Microsoft Edge"

});

browser.contextMenus.onClicked.addListener((info, tab) => { 

   switch (info.menuItemId) {        case "ff2edge":            url = info.linkUrl || info.frameUrl || info.pageUrl;            if (url) ff2edge(url);            break;    }

});

browser.browserAction.onClicked.addListener((tab) => { 

   ff2edge(tab.url);

});
creator: deanone

title: Firefox using Apple Private Relay DNS
content:
Hello,

I'm trying to get my Firefox on Mac to use the DNS supplied by my DHCP. If I have Apple's Private Relay turned off, everything works correctly. However, if Apple's Private Relay is turned on, then Firefox will use Apple's Private Relay DNS (Cloudfare in my location). I have confirmed it's a configuration problem in Firefox because Chrome uses the correct DNS, and so does dig in the terminal.

I have tried:

  • Resetting Firefox to default settings
  • Uninstall and reinstall Firefox, including deleting the Firefox folder that contains the Profiles folder and profiles.ini file
  • Clearing cache and Firefox DNS at about:networking#dns
  • In Network Settings, tried 'No Proxy', 'Auto-detect proxy settings for this network', and 'Use system proxy settings'
  • Confirmed Enable DNS over HTTPS is not checked (If I check it, then it does work correctly, but that isn't my goal)

Thanks for any help!
creator: Prologue6054

title: Primary password issue with the portable version.
content:
I installed Firefox portable version on my computer A and B. I set up the primary password on the computer B. I found that I forgot the primary password yesterday. So, I deleted Firefox from the computer B. Afterwards, I copied and pasted the Firefox portable from the computer A to B. Everything looked fine. The primary password checkbox was unchecked, so I didn't need to worry about it.

However, when I launch Firefox on the computer B today, it asked me the primary password again. As far as I know, all data is saved in the portable folder and I don't understand why it happened. How do I solve this issue?

title: Avast Secure Browser imposes itself by opening on start up
content: Avast Secure Browser imposes itself by opening on start up despite my attempts to stop it doing so. Avast has loaded it on , I never elected to do so ...but that said I do not wish to totally remove it from my lap top as it is, as it were, an insurance policy against Firefox becoming inoperable. I have explored switching off this attribute of avast browser in the browser but to date have been unsuccessful. As a retired man in my seventies I am limited in my peer group for finding anyone that is computer literate YET this technology is so beneficial to people such as myself I believe.
